name: Sam Altman
description: Co-founder of OpenAI, who after being terminated was set to return but the negotiations broke down. Later it was reported that he would be joining Microsoft.

wikipedia.name: Sam Altman
wikipedia.extract: Samuel Harris Altman (; AWLT-mən; born April 22, 1985) is an American entrepreneur and investor, who has been the CEO of OpenAI since 2019 (he was briefly fired and reinstated in November 2023). Prior to OpenAI, Altman was president of Y Combinator from 2014 to 2019.
wikipedia.description: Samuel Harris Altman, born April 22, 1985, is an American entrepreneur and investor, currently serving as the CEO of OpenAI, and was previously the president of Y Combinator from 2014 to 2019.

stated_goals.item: Promote advancements in AI
stated_goals.quote: Altman has been looking to raise tens of billions of dollars from Middle Eastern sovereign wealth funds to create an AI chip startup

stated_goals.item: Create a new venture for AI-oriented hardware
stated_goals.quote: Altman was courting SoftBank Group Corp. chairman Masayoshi Son for a multibillion-dollar investment in a new company to make AI-oriented hardware

stated_goals.item: Lead a new advanced AI research team
stated_goals.quote: Sam Altman and Greg Brockman, together with colleagues, will be joining Microsoft to lead a new advanced AI research team.

main_motivations.quote: Altman has been looking to raise tens of billions of dollars from Middle Eastern sovereign wealth funds to create an AI chip startup

The OpenAI we know today was seven years in the making, so the venture will not be an effective competitor overnight. However, X.ai has shown how quickly a new team that already knows what they are doing can build a credible solution.

possible_actions.item: Return as CEO of OpenAI if board resigns
possible_actions.quote: OpenAI announces an agreement in principle for Sam Altman to return as CEO and appoints a new three-person oversight board.
Altman will almost certainly emerge from this with a well-funded new company with a strong lineup of technical staff that want to join him and Greg Brockman.

possible_actions.item: Leading a new advanced AI research team at Microsoft
possible_actions.quote: Sam Altman and Greg Brockman, together with colleagues, will be joining Microsoft to lead a new advanced AI research team.

good_scenarios.item: Commercialisation of AI, building a new venture
good_scenarios.quote: Altman has been looking to raise tens of billions of dollars from Middle Eastern sovereign wealth funds to create an AI chip startup to compete with processors made by Nvidia Corp.

good_scenarios.item: Successful setup of a new AI research team at Microsoft
good_scenarios.quote: Sam Altman and Greg Brockman, together with colleagues, will be joining Microsoft to lead a new advanced AI research team.

bad_scenarios.quote: OpenAI announced that Sam Altman was being dismissed and Greg Brockman would stay with the company but lose his role as board chairman.
The controversy centered on a disagreement over how quickly to commercialize the technology and the steps related to ensuring it does not impact “safety.”

bad_scenarios.item: Inability to control the market narrative
bad_scenarios.quote: However, the rift will have lasting consequences. It will not have the same ability to control the market narrative.

main_fears.item: Conflict over fast commercialisation of AI technology
main_fears.quote: The controversy centered on a disagreement over how quickly to commercialize the technology and the steps related to ensuring it does not impact “safety.”

main_fears.item: Risk of Slow Progress due to Safety Concerns
main_fears.quote: They can still get access to OpenAI’s API and a stable instance of the solutions through Azure OpenAI Service, but there will surely be concern that OpenAI may not be as aggressive around new feature introductions in the future because of “safety” concerns.

main_fears.item: Loss of Influence and Financial Support
main_fears.quote: The bigger issue will be OpenAI’s funding situation.

resources.quote: Altman was courting SoftBank Group Corp. chairman Masayoshi Son for a multibillion-dollar investment in a new company to make AI-oriented hardware.

The OpenAI we know today was seven years in the making, so the venture will not be an effective competitor overnight. However, X.ai has shown how quickly a new team that already knows what they are doing can build a credible solution.
Altman won’t have Sutskever to lean on for technical skill, but he should have top-notch researchers.

name: OpenAI
description: An artificial intelligence research group comprising the for-profit arm, OpenAI LP, and its parent company, the non-profit OpenAI Inc.

wikipedia.name: OpenAI
wikipedia.extract: OpenAI is an American artificial intelligence (AI) research organization consisting of the non-profit OpenAI, Inc. registered in Delaware and its for-profit subsidiary OpenAI Global, LLC. OpenAI researches artificial intelligence with the declared intention of developing "safe and beneficial" artificial general intelligence, which it defines as "highly autonomous systems that outperform humans at most economically valuable work". OpenAI has also developed several large language models, such as ChatGPT and GPT-4, as well as advanced image generation models like DALL-E 3, and in the past published open-source models.The organization was founded in December 2015 by Ilya Sutskever, Greg Brockman, Trevor Blackwell, Vicki Cheung, Andrej Karpathy, Durk Kingma, Jessica Livingston, John Schulman, Pamela Vagata, and Wojciech Zaremba, with Sam Altman and Elon Musk serving as the initial board members. Microsoft provided OpenAI Global LLC with a $1 billion investment in 2019 and a $10 billion investment in 2023, with a significant portion of the investment in the form of compute resources on Microsoft's Azure cloud service.On November 17, 2023, the board removed Altman as CEO, while Brockman was removed as chairman and then resigned as president. Four days later, both returned after negotiations with the board, and most of the board members resigned. The new initial board included former Salesforce co-CEO Bret Taylor as chairman. OpenAI also announced that Microsoft would have a non-voting board seat at OpenAI.
wikipedia.description: OpenAI is an American AI research organization, focusing on developing "safe and beneficial" artificial general intelligence and producing large language and image generation models, funded by significant investments by Microsoft.

stated_goals.item: Safe AI development
stated_goals.quote: The controversy centered on a disagreement over how quickly to commercialize the technology and the steps related to ensuring it does not impact “safety.”

stated_goals.item: Alignment of AI with safety precautions
stated_goals.quote: What precipitated this? There is speculation that OpenAI has made a new technical breakthrough that worried some board members from an alignment (i.e., safety) perspective.

main_motivations.quote: Ilya Sutskever is now the sole remaining co-founder of OpenAI. Regardless of who the CEO is, Sutskever will be the company's central figure.
Sutskever, according to Bloomberg’s reporting, was displeased.

possible_actions.quote: Emmett Shear, the co-founder of Twitch, was named interim CEO.
Most of the speculation is that the breakthrough involves GPT-5, which may be in early testing.
Altman will almost certainly emerge from this with a well-funded new company with a strong lineup of technical staff that want to join him and Greg Brockman.

good_scenarios.item: Beneficial partnerships
good_scenarios.quote: Altman will almost certainly emerge from this with a well-funded new company with a strong lineup of technical staff that want to join him and Greg Brockman.

good_scenarios.item: Sufficient funding
good_scenarios.quote: The company will emerge weaker from this episode and that may be fine with Sutskever and the board. Their focus on “safety” is entirely compatible with less growth.

bad_scenarios.quote: The company’s influence will be based primarily on its ability to lead in the innovation department, which may be harder to accomplish with a smaller team and fewer resources.
Many resignations by employees loyal to Altman and Brockman are expected.
The bigger issue will be OpenAI’s funding situation. I suspect they will close a funding round soon to help establish confidence in the newly reorganized team.

main_fears.item: Misalignment of AI with safety standards
main_fears.quote: Most of the speculation is that the breakthrough involves GPT-5, which may be in early testing. Sutskever believes the new capabilities are moving more quickly toward artificial general intelligence (AGI) or superintelligence.

main_fears.item: Loss of influence and resources
main_fears.quote: The company’s influence will be based primarily on its ability to lead in the innovation department, which may be harder to accomplish with a smaller team and fewer resources.

resources.quote: Semafor reported that only a fraction of Microsoft’s $10 billion investment in OpenAI has been delivered in the form of cash.
It is divided into tranches released over time and most of it is in the form of Azure cloud computing credits.

name: Emmett Shear
description: Co-founder of Amazon-owned video streaming site Twitch, who took over as interim CEO of OpenAI.

wikipedia.name: Emmett Shear
wikipedia.extract: Emmett Shear (born 1983) is an American Internet entrepreneur and investor. He is the co-founder of live video platform Justin.tv. He served as the chief executive officer of Twitch when it was spun off from Justin.tv until March 2023. In 2011, Shear was appointed as a part-time partner at venture capital firm Y Combinator. In November 2023, he briefly served as interim CEO of OpenAI.
wikipedia.description: Emmett Shear, born 1983, is an American Internet entrepreneur and investor, known as the co-founder of Justin.tv and former CEO of Twitch, and for his brief tenure as interim CEO of OpenAI in 2023.

stated_goals.item: Promotes safe advancement and implementation of artificial intelligence
stated_goals.quote: Shear is known as an outspoken member of the ‘safety’ side of AI discourse. He's said earlier this year in an interview that its existential risk should make you ‘shit your pants,’ and has talked about AI safety on X, the social media site formerly known as Twitter, as being like navigating 'the creation of an alien god.'

main_motivations.item: Commitment to ensuring safety in artificial intelligence
main_motivations.quote: Shear is known as an outspoken member of the ‘safety’ side of AI discourse.

name: Microsoft
description: A key investor in OpenAI. CEO Satya announced that Sam Altman and Greg Brockman would be joining Microsoft.

wikipedia.name: Microsoft
wikipedia.extract:
Microsoft Corporation is an American multinational technology corporation headquartered in Redmond, Washington. Microsoft's best-known software products are the Windows line of operating systems, the Microsoft 365 suite of productivity applications, and the Edge web browser. Its flagship hardware products are the Xbox video game consoles and the Microsoft Surface lineup of touchscreen personal computers. Microsoft ranked No. 14 in the 2022 Fortune 500 rankings of the largest United States corporations by total revenue; it was the world's largest software maker by revenue as of 2022. It is considered one of the Big Five American information technology companies, alongside Alphabet (parent company of Google), Amazon, Apple, and Meta.
Microsoft was founded by Bill Gates and Paul Allen on April 4, 1975, to develop and sell BASIC interpreters for the Altair 8800. It rose to dominate the personal computer operating system market with MS-DOS in the mid-1980s, followed by Windows. The company's 1986 initial public offering (IPO) and subsequent rise in its share price created three billionaires and an estimated 12,000 millionaires among Microsoft employees. Since the 1990s, it has increasingly diversified from the operating system market and has made several corporate acquisitions, the largest being the acquisition of Activision Blizzard for $68.7 billion in October 2023, followed by its acquisition of LinkedIn for $26.2 billion in December 2016, and its acquisition of Skype Technologies for $8.5 billion in May 2011.As of 2015, Microsoft is market-dominant in the IBM PC compatible operating system market and the office software suite market, although it has lost the majority of the overall operating system market to Android. The company also produces a wide range of other consumer and enterprise software for desktops, laptops, tabs, gadgets, and servers, including Internet search (with Bing), the digital services market (through MSN), mixed reality (HoloLens), cloud computing (Azure), and software development (Visual Studio).
Steve Ballmer replaced Gates as CEO in 2000 and later envisioned a "devices and services" strategy. This unfolded with Microsoft acquiring Danger Inc. in 2008, entering the personal computer production market for the first time in June 2012 with the launch of the Microsoft Surface line of tablet computers, and later forming Microsoft Mobile through the acquisition of Nokia's devices and services division. Since Satya Nadella took over as CEO in 2014, the company has scaled back on hardware and instead focused on cloud computing, a move that helped the company's shares reach their highest value since December 1999. Under Nadella's direction, the company has also heavily expanded its gaming business to support the Xbox brand, establishing the Microsoft Gaming division in 2022, dedicated to operating Xbox in addition to its three subsidiaries (publishers). Microsoft Gaming is the third-largest gaming company in the world by revenue as of 2023.Earlier dethroned by Apple in 2010, in 2018, Microsoft reclaimed its position as the most valuable publicly traded company in the world. In April 2019, Microsoft reached a trillion-dollar market cap, becoming the third U.S. public company to be valued at over $1 trillion after Apple and Amazon, respectively. As of 2023, Microsoft has the third-highest global brand valuation.
Microsoft has been criticized for its monopolistic practices and the company's software has been criticized for problems with ease of use, robustness, and security.
wikipedia.description: Microsoft Corporation, an American multinational headquartered in Redmond, Washington, is known for software products including the Windows operating systems and Microsoft 365 applications, along with hardware products like Xbox consoles and Surface personal computers, and is globally recognized as one of the biggest revenue-earning software makers and an influential entity among the Big Five IT companies in the US.

stated_goals.item: Make big bets in generative AI
stated_goals.quote: Microsoft now has two big bets in generative AI, and the company has an insurance policy against OpenAI not fulfilling its innovation commitments.

stated_goals.item: Calm company's investors and become an important alternative
stated_goals.quote: Microsoft’s new group will not have an impact overnight, but it will calm the company’s investors and, over time, may become an important alternative.

main_motivations.item: Influence the advancement of generative AI
main_motivations.quote: Satya Nadella would have preferred the incident never happened. His strategy is so dependent on OpenAI at the moment that he will need to double his efforts to make sure the company delivers on its near-term commitments.

possible_actions.quote: Satya Nadella announced on X and LinkedIn that “Sam Altman and Greg Brockman, together with colleagues, will be joining Microsoft to lead a new advanced AI research team.”

possible_actions.item: Curtail funding commitment to OpenAI as a fallback
possible_actions.quote: I suspect Microsoft will immediately look to hedge its bets to have a fallback option. That may even involve curtailing its past funding commitment to OpenAI. Some of that freed-up cash may go to Altman’s new venture.

good_scenarios.item: Stable functioning of OpenAI
good_scenarios.quote: His strategy is so dependent on OpenAI at the moment that he will need to double his efforts to make sure the company delivers on its near-term commitments.

bad_scenarios.quote: In fact, it may get a lot of the team quickly if the OpenAI board doesn’t resign. Over 500 staffers have threatened to resign.

bad_scenarios.item: Inability to exercise control over AI development
bad_scenarios.quote: The company’s influence will be based primarily on its ability to lead in the innovation department, which may be harder to accomplish with a smaller team and fewer resources.

main_fears.item: OpenAI not fulfilling its innovation commitments
main_fears.quote: Microsoft now has two big bets in generative AI, and the company has an insurance policy against OpenAI not fulfilling its innovation commitments.

main_fears.item: OpenAI's inability to deliver on commitments
main_fears.quote: His strategy is so dependent on OpenAI at the moment that he will need to double his efforts to make sure the company delivers on its near-term commitments.

resources.quote: Sam Altman and Greg Brockman, together with colleagues, will be joining Microsoft.

resources.item: Freed-up cash from curtailing funding to OpenAI
resources.quote: That may even involve curtailing its past funding commitment to OpenAI. Some of that freed-up cash may go to Altman’s new venture.

name: Satya Nadella
description: Microsoft's CEO, reported to be personally assisting in the negotiations over Altman’s return. Later, he announced that Altman and Brockman would be joining Microsoft.

wikipedia.name: Satya Nadella
wikipedia.extract: Satya Narayana Nadella (; born 19 August 1967) is an Indian-American business executive. He is the executive chairman and CEO of Microsoft, succeeding Steve Ballmer in 2014 as CEO and John W. Thompson in 2021 as chairman. Before becoming CEO, he was the executive vice president of Microsoft's cloud and enterprise group, responsible for building and running the company's computing platforms.
wikipedia.description: Satya Narayana Nadella, born on 19 August 1967, is an Indian-American business executive serving as the executive chairman and CEO of Microsoft since 2014.

name: Greg Brockman
description: Reported to be joining Microsoft with Sam Altman. He had previously been let go from OpenAI's board.

wikipedia.name: Greg Brockman
wikipedia.extract: Greg Brockman (born November 29, 1987) is an American entrepreneur, investor and software developer who is a co-founder and currently the president of OpenAI. He began his career at Stripe in 2010, upon leaving MIT, and became their CTO in 2013. He left Stripe in 2015 to co-found OpenAI, where he also assumed the role of CTO.
wikipedia.description: Greg Brockman is an American entrepreneur, software developer, and co-founder of OpenAI, who formerly held the position of CTO at Stripe.

stated_goals.item: Push advances in AI technology
stated_goals.quote: Sam Altman and Greg Brockman, together with colleagues, will be joining Microsoft to lead a new advanced AI research team.

stated_goals.item: Retain OpenAI's team
stated_goals.quote: According to a post on X by Kara Swisher, 505 of 700 employees have demanded the board resign or they plan to depart the company.

main_motivations.quote: The Elephant in the Room: There is speculation that OpenAI has made a new technical breakthrough that worried some board members from an alignment (i.e., safety) perspective. Altman and Brockman were impressed and unconcerned about integrating it into the product.

main_motivations.item: Protection of OpenAI's reputation and financial stability
main_motivations.quote: Microsoft now has two big bets in generative AI, and the company has an insurance policy against OpenAI not fulfilling its innovation commitments.

possible_actions.quote: Sam Altman and Greg Brockman, together with colleagues, will be joining Microsoft.

possible_actions.item: Potentially start a new venture in AI
possible_actions.quote: Altman will almost certainly emerge from this with a well-funded new company with a strong lineup of technical staff that want to join him and Greg Brockman.

good_scenarios.item: Being able to continue AI work at Microsoft
good_scenarios.quote: Update 11/20/23: In a surprising twist, Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella posted on LinkedIn just two hours after news of the negotiations broke down that Sam Altman and Greg Brockman would be joining Microsoft.

good_scenarios.item: Securing the position of OpenAI employees
good_scenarios.quote: They have all been offered jobs at Microsoft and threatened to leave the OpenAI to continue their work.

bad_scenarios.quote: OpenAI announced that Sam Altman was being dismissed and Greg Brockman would stay with the company but lose his role as board chairman.

bad_scenarios.item: Instability and potential jeopardisation of OpenAI’s operations and future product development
bad_scenarios.quote: Semafor reported that only a fraction of Microsoft’s $10 billion investment in OpenAI has been delivered in the form of cash. If Microsoft were to cut this off, OpenAI’s operations and future product development could be in jeopardy.

main_fears.item: Losing OpenAI team members and weakening the company
main_fears.quote: This fallout is harder to predict, but it will be a difficult period. Many resignations by employees loyal to Altman and Brockman are expected to follow the email from Sutskever to OpenAI staff on Sunday evening.

main_fears.item: Instability in OpenAI’s innovative progression
main_fears.quote: The company’s influence will be based primarily on its ability to lead in the innovation department, which may be harder to accomplish with a smaller team and fewer resources.

resources.quote: Sam Altman and Greg Brockman, together with colleagues, will be joining Microsoft to lead a new advanced AI research team.

name: Ilya Sutskever
description: OpenAI chief scientist and co-founder, reportedly led the ouster of Altman and Brockman. Later, he was reported to be supporting the staff's call for the board to resign.

wikipedia.name: Ilya Sutskever
wikipedia.extract: Ilya Sutskever  (Hebrew: איליה סוצקבר; Russian: Илья Суцкевер; /ilja su:ʦkɪvər/ born 1985/86) is a computer scientist working in machine learning. He is a co-founder and Chief Scientist at OpenAI.He has made several major contributions to the field of deep learning. In 2023, Sutskever and the OpenAI board fired CEO Sam Altman, who returned a week later. He is the co-inventor, with Alex Krizhevsky and Geoffrey Hinton, of AlexNet, a convolutional neural network. Sutskever is also one of the many co-authors of the AlphaGo paper.
wikipedia.description: Ilya Sutskever is a renowned computer scientist and co-founder of OpenAI who has made significant contributions to deep learning, including the co-invention of AlexNet, a convolutional neural network.

stated_goals.item: Ensuring the safety of AI development
stated_goals.quote: Sutskever, who was responsible for the company’s key technical breakthroughs, said he and the three other board members who removed Altman stand by their decision as the ‘only path’ to defend the company’s mission.

stated_goals.item: Prevent the immediate commercialization of AI
stated_goals.quote: The controversy centered on a disagreement over how quickly to commercialize the technology and the steps related to ensuring it does not impact “safety.

main_motivations.item: Strict safety guidelines and slower progress in AI advancement
main_motivations.quote: Most investors in this saga are in the “boomer” camp
Ilya Sutskever is now the sole remaining co-founder of OpenAI. Regardless of who the CEO is, Sutskever will be the company's central figure.

possible_actions.quote: Once Sutskever agreed to support the move, he was destined to be the spokesman for the board.

Sutskever and his allies on the OpenAI board chafed at Altman’s efforts to raised [sic] funds off of OpenAI’s name, and they harbored concerns that the new businesses might not share the same governance model as OpenAI.

good_scenarios.quote: The company’s influence will be based primarily on its ability to lead in the innovation department.

bad_scenarios.quote: The controversy centered on a disagreement over how quickly to commercialize the technology.
Many resignations by employees loyal to Altman and Brockman are expected to follow the email from Sutskever.

main_fears.item: Losing control over the safety measures of AI development
main_fears.quote: On one side are the “doomers”, who believe that, left unchecked, ai poses an existential risk to humanity and hence advocate stricter regulations.

main_fears.item: Potential for OpenAI to rapidly commercialize AI without ensuring safety measures
main_fears.quote: The controversy centered on a disagreement over how quickly to commercialize the technology.

resources.quote: Ilya Sutskever is now the sole remaining co-founder of OpenAI. Regardless of who the CEO is, Sutskever will be the company's central figure.

resources.item: Presence and influence in the board
resources.quote: Sutskever later appealed to the board, winning over some members.

name: Mira Murati
description: OpenAI CTO, elevated to the position of interim CTO following Sam Altman's dismissal.

wikipedia.name: Mira Murati
wikipedia.extract: Mira Murati (born 16 December 1988) is an Albanian engineer and business manager who has been serving as chief technology officer of OpenAI since 2018.She briefly served as  interim chief executive officer of OpenAI from 17 to 20 November 2023.
wikipedia.description: Mira Murati, born in 1988, is an Albanian engineer and business manager who has been the chief technology officer at OpenAI since 2018 and served briefly as its interim CEO in 2023.

stated_goals.item: Have the board reinstate OpenAI to its original state
stated_goals.quote: According to The Information, “Murati told staff Sunday that she and her team were ‘the first to ask the board to reinstate OpenAI to its previous state.’”

main_motivations.quote: Murati told staff Sunday that she and her team were ‘the first to ask the board to reinstate OpenAI to its previous state.’

possible_actions.item: Leave OpenAI to join Altman's venture
possible_actions.quote: If Altman is unable to return to OpenAI, Microsoft would consider investing in Altman’s new venture, one of the people said.

possible_actions.item: Return to her previous role as CTO
possible_actions.quote: It is unclear whether Mira Murati will return to her previous role as CTO.

good_scenarios.item: Board reinstates OpenAI to its previous state
good_scenarios.quote: Murati told staff Sunday that she and her team were ‘the first to ask the board to reinstate OpenAI to its previous state.’

bad_scenarios.item: Continued uncertainty with the board and leadership of OpenAI
bad_scenarios.quote: However, the negotiations may have just been a stalling tactic that enabled Sutskever and the board to marshall supporters and identify an interim CEO who would instill more stakeholder confidence.
If Microsoft were to cut this off, OpenAI’s operations and future product development could be in jeopardy.

name: Bloomberg
description: A news outlet that provided several updates on the situation.

wikipedia.name: Bloomberg News
wikipedia.extract: Bloomberg News (originally Bloomberg Business News) is an international news agency headquartered in New York City and a division of Bloomberg L.P. Content produced by Bloomberg News is disseminated through Bloomberg Terminals, Bloomberg Television, Bloomberg Radio, Bloomberg Businessweek, Bloomberg Markets, Bloomberg.com, and Bloomberg's mobile platforms. Since 2015, John Micklethwait has served as editor-in-chief.
wikipedia.description: Bloomberg News is an international news agency, a division of Bloomberg L.P., distributing content through various platforms such as Bloomberg Terminals, TV, Radio, Businessweek, Markets, the Bloomberg website, and mobile apps, with John Micklethwait as its current editor-in-chief since 2015.

name: Brad Lightcap
description: OpenAI's chief operating officer, who shared a memo with company staff about the incident.

wikipedia.name: OpenAI
wikipedia.extract: OpenAI is an American artificial intelligence (AI) research organization consisting of the non-profit OpenAI, Inc. registered in Delaware and its for-profit subsidiary OpenAI Global, LLC. OpenAI researches artificial intelligence with the declared intention of developing "safe and beneficial" artificial general intelligence, which it defines as "highly autonomous systems that outperform humans at most economically valuable work". OpenAI has also developed several large language models, such as ChatGPT and GPT-4, as well as advanced image generation models like DALL-E 3, and in the past published open-source models.The organization was founded in December 2015 by Ilya Sutskever, Greg Brockman, Trevor Blackwell, Vicki Cheung, Andrej Karpathy, Durk Kingma, Jessica Livingston, John Schulman, Pamela Vagata, and Wojciech Zaremba, with Sam Altman and Elon Musk serving as the initial board members. Microsoft provided OpenAI Global LLC with a $1 billion investment in 2019 and a $10 billion investment in 2023, with a significant portion of the investment in the form of compute resources on Microsoft's Azure cloud service.On November 17, 2023, the board removed Altman as CEO, while Brockman was removed as chairman and then resigned as president. Four days later, both returned after negotiations with the board, and most of the board members resigned. The new initial board included former Salesforce co-CEO Bret Taylor as chairman. OpenAI also announced that Microsoft would have a non-voting board seat at OpenAI.
wikipedia.description: OpenAI is an American AI research organization, focusing on developing "safe and beneficial" artificial general intelligence and producing large language and image generation models, funded by significant investments by Microsoft.

stated_goals.item: Safe AI development
stated_goals.quote: The controversy centered on a disagreement over how quickly to commercialize the technology and the steps related to ensuring it does not impact “safety.”

stated_goals.item: Alignment of AI with safety precautions
stated_goals.quote: What precipitated this? There is speculation that OpenAI has made a new technical breakthrough that worried some board members from an alignment (i.e., safety) perspective.

main_motivations.quote: Ilya Sutskever is now the sole remaining co-founder of OpenAI. Regardless of who the CEO is, Sutskever will be the company's central figure.
Sutskever, according to Bloomberg’s reporting, was displeased.

possible_actions.quote: Emmett Shear, the co-founder of Twitch, was named interim CEO.
Most of the speculation is that the breakthrough involves GPT-5, which may be in early testing.
Altman will almost certainly emerge from this with a well-funded new company with a strong lineup of technical staff that want to join him and Greg Brockman.

good_scenarios.item: Beneficial partnerships
good_scenarios.quote: Altman will almost certainly emerge from this with a well-funded new company with a strong lineup of technical staff that want to join him and Greg Brockman.

good_scenarios.item: Sufficient funding
good_scenarios.quote: The company will emerge weaker from this episode and that may be fine with Sutskever and the board. Their focus on “safety” is entirely compatible with less growth.

bad_scenarios.quote: The company’s influence will be based primarily on its ability to lead in the innovation department, which may be harder to accomplish with a smaller team and fewer resources.
Many resignations by employees loyal to Altman and Brockman are expected.
The bigger issue will be OpenAI’s funding situation. I suspect they will close a funding round soon to help establish confidence in the newly reorganized team.

main_fears.item: Misalignment of AI with safety standards
main_fears.quote: Most of the speculation is that the breakthrough involves GPT-5, which may be in early testing. Sutskever believes the new capabilities are moving more quickly toward artificial general intelligence (AGI) or superintelligence.

main_fears.item: Loss of influence and resources
main_fears.quote: The company’s influence will be based primarily on its ability to lead in the innovation department, which may be harder to accomplish with a smaller team and fewer resources.

resources.quote: Semafor reported that only a fraction of Microsoft’s $10 billion investment in OpenAI has been delivered in the form of cash.
It is divided into tranches released over time and most of it is in the form of Azure cloud computing credits.

name: Thrive Capital
description: Leading the upcoming funding round for OpenAI at an $86 billion valuation.

wikipedia.name: Thrive Capital
wikipedia.extract: Thrive Capital is an American venture capital firm based in New York City. It focuses on software and internet investments. The firm was founded by Joshua Kushner who is also co-founder of Oscar Health and minority owner of the Memphis Grizzlies.
wikipedia.description: Thrive Capital is a New York-based American venture capital firm, founded by Joshua Kushner, specializing in software and internet investments.

name: Tiger Global and Sequoia
description: Key investors in OpenAI, who had pressured the board to reverse their decision.

wikipedia.name: Sequoia Capital
wikipedia.extract:
Sequoia Capital is an American venture capital firm headquartered in Menlo Park, California which specializes in seed stage, early stage, and growth stage investments in private companies across technology sectors. As of 2022, the firm had approximately US$85 billion in assets under management.Sequoia is an umbrella brand for three different venture entities: one focused on the U.S. and Europe, another on India and Southeast Asia, and a third on China.
Notable successful investments made by the firm include Apple, Cisco, Google, NVIDIA, YouTube, Instagram, LinkedIn, PayPal, Reddit, Tumblr, WhatsApp, and Zoom.Notable unsuccessful investments made by the firm include about US$214m lost on FTX.
wikipedia.description: Sequoia Capital is a U.S.-based venture capital firm, with about US$85 billion in assets, specializing in investments in private technology companies at various stages, with notable successes including Apple, Google, and Instagram.

main_motivations.quote: Tiger Global and Sequoia, key investors in OpenAI, pressured the board to reverse the decision. (The Information)

bad_scenarios.quote: The Information reported on rumors from OpenAI insiders that the upcoming funding round led by Thrive Capital at an $86 billion valuation was unlikely to close due to the management shake-up.

name: Semafor
description: The news outlet that reported about Microsoft's investment in OpenAI.

wikipedia.name: Semafor (website)
wikipedia.extract: Semafor is a news website founded in 2022 by Ben Smith, a former editor-in-chief of BuzzFeed News and media columnist at The New York Times, and Justin B. Smith, the former CEO of Bloomberg Media Group.
wikipedia.description: "Semafor is a news website, founded in 2022 by former BuzzFeed and New York Times editor Ben Smith and ex-Bloomberg Media Group CEO Justin B. Smith."

main_motivations.item: Presenting insider information about the dynamics within the tech and AI industry
main_motivations.quote: Semafor reported that only a fraction of Microsoft’s $10 billion investment in OpenAI has been delivered in the form of cash.

possible_actions.item: Reporting on the internal dynamics within tech companies and investments
possible_actions.quote: Semafor reported that only a fraction of Microsoft’s $10 billion investment in OpenAI has been delivered in the form of cash.

good_scenarios.item: Access to insider information allowing them to deliver timely and accurate reports
good_scenarios.quote: Semafor reported that only a fraction of Microsoft’s $10 billion investment in OpenAI has been delivered in the form of cash.

name: Vinod Khosla
description: Founder of Khosla Ventures, the earliest outside investor in OpenAI, who said he wanted Altman back.

wikipedia.name: Vinod Khosla
wikipedia.extract: Vinod Khosla (born 28 January 1955) is an Indian-American businessman and venture capitalist. He is a co-founder of Sun Microsystems and the founder of Khosla Ventures. Khosla made his wealth from early venture capital investments in areas such as networking, software, and alternative energy technologies. He is considered one of the most successful and influential venture capitalists.In 2014, Forbes counted him among the 400 richest people in the United States. In 2021, he was ranked 92nd on the Forbes 400 list.
wikipedia.description: Vinod Khosla is an Indian-American businessman and venture capitalist, who co-founded Sun Microsystems and founded Khosla Ventures, earning his wealth through early venture capital investments in areas such as networking, software, and alternative energy technologies.

stated_goals.item: Vinod Khosla expressed the desire to see Sam Altman reinstated at OpenAI
stated_goals.quote: Vinod Khosla says Khosla Ventures, the earliest outside investor in OpenAI, said he wanted Altman back.

main_motivations.item: Support for strategic leadership and strong direction at companies Vinod Khosla invests in
main_motivations.quote: Vinod Khosla says Khosla Ventures, the earliest outside investor in OpenAI, said he wanted Altman back.

possible_actions.item: Vinod Khosla, as an investor, could possibly voice support for certain strategic decisions or leadership choices at OpenAI
possible_actions.quote: Vinod Khosla says Khosla Ventures, the earliest outside investor in OpenAI, said he wanted Altman back.

good_scenarios.item: For Khosla, a positive scenario would involve leadership stability and continued innovation at OpenAI, one of his investment companies
good_scenarios.quote: Vinod Khosla says Khosla Ventures, the earliest outside investor in OpenAI, said he wanted Altman back.

bad_scenarios.item: For Khosla, a negative scenario might be leadership instability or decisions that could potentially slow down innovation at his investment companies
bad_scenarios.quote: This fallout is harder to predict, but it will be a difficult period. Many resignations by employees loyal to Altman and Brockman are expected to follow the email from Sutskever to OpenAI staff on Sunday evening.

main_fears.item: Khosla may be concerned about instability and strategy changes at his investment companies
main_fears.quote: This fallout is harder to predict, but it will be a difficult period. Many resignations by employees loyal to Altman and Brockman are expected to follow the email from Sutskever to OpenAI staff on Sunday evening.

resources.item: As a venture capitalist and businessman, Khosla has financial resources and business networks at his disposal
resources.quote: Vinod Khosla says Khosla Ventures, the earliest outside investor in OpenAI, said he wanted Altman back.

name: Dario Amodei
description: Anthropic’s co-founder and CEO, who was approached by OpenAI's board about joining their company as CEO.

wikipedia.name: OpenAI
wikipedia.extract: OpenAI is an American artificial intelligence (AI) research organization consisting of the non-profit OpenAI, Inc. registered in Delaware and its for-profit subsidiary OpenAI Global, LLC. OpenAI researches artificial intelligence with the declared intention of developing "safe and beneficial" artificial general intelligence, which it defines as "highly autonomous systems that outperform humans at most economically valuable work". OpenAI has also developed several large language models, such as ChatGPT and GPT-4, as well as advanced image generation models like DALL-E 3, and in the past published open-source models.The organization was founded in December 2015 by Ilya Sutskever, Greg Brockman, Trevor Blackwell, Vicki Cheung, Andrej Karpathy, Durk Kingma, Jessica Livingston, John Schulman, Pamela Vagata, and Wojciech Zaremba, with Sam Altman and Elon Musk serving as the initial board members. Microsoft provided OpenAI Global LLC with a $1 billion investment in 2019 and a $10 billion investment in 2023, with a significant portion of the investment in the form of compute resources on Microsoft's Azure cloud service.On November 17, 2023, the board removed Altman as CEO, while Brockman was removed as chairman and then resigned as president. Four days later, both returned after negotiations with the board, and most of the board members resigned. The new initial board included former Salesforce co-CEO Bret Taylor as chairman. OpenAI also announced that Microsoft would have a non-voting board seat at OpenAI.
wikipedia.description: OpenAI is an American AI research organization, focusing on developing "safe and beneficial" artificial general intelligence and producing large language and image generation models, funded by significant investments by Microsoft.

name: Nat Friedman
description: GitHub’s former CEO, who was approached by OpenAI's board for joining.

wikipedia.name: Nat Friedman
wikipedia.extract: Nathaniel Dourif Friedman is an American technology executive and investor. He was the chief executive officer (CEO) of GitHub, and former Chairman of the GNOME Foundation. Friedman is currently a board member at the Arc Institute, and an advisor of Midjourney.
wikipedia.description: Nathaniel Dourif Friedman is an American tech executive and investor who was the CEO of GitHub, Chairman of the GNOME Foundation, and is currently a board member at the Arc Institute and an advisor of Midjourney.

possible_actions.item: Considering role positions in different AI institutions due to his expertise
possible_actions.quote: OpenAI’s board approached Anthropic’s co-founder and CEO, Dario Amodei, about joining the company as CEO or engineering a merger of the two generative AI powerhouses. GitHub’s former CEO Nat Friedman and Scale AI CEO Alex Wang were also approached. All three declined. (The Information)

name: Alex Wang
description: Scale AI CEO who was approached by OpenAI's board for joining.

wikipedia.name: Removal of Sam Altman from OpenAI
wikipedia.extract:
On November 17, 2023, OpenAI's board of directors removed co-founder and chief executive Sam Altman with a statement that it had no confidence in Altman's leadership.  
Approximately 107 hours later, after an intense pressure campaign from investors and a threatened mass resignation of OpenAI’s employees, OpenAI announced that it had reached an agreement in principle to have Altman return as CEO with a reconstituted board of the non-profit entity which oversees the for-profit company. Altman’s announced return was the third change of CEO announcement within a chaotic 4.5 day period.
wikipedia.description: Sam Altman was removed as CEO by OpenAI's board due to lack of confidence but was reinstated after pressure from investors and potential employee resignations, marking the third CEO change within a tumultuous 4.5 day period in November 2023.

stated_goals.item: To defend company's mission
stated_goals.quote: sutskever, who was responsible for the company’s key technical breakthroughs, said he and the three other board members who removed Altman stand by their decision as the ‘only path’ to defend the company’s mission

main_motivations.quote: The controversy centered on a disagreement over how quickly to commercialize the technology and the steps related to ensuring it does not impact “safety.

main_motivations.quote: Sutskever and his allies on the OpenAI board chafed at Altman’s efforts to raised [sic] funds off of OpenAI’s name

possible_actions.item: Delaying or cancelling Altman's new technology integration due to safety concerns
